intro: Penaea microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved penaea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial shade. Penaea microphylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and seasonal blooms.
